definition: to delegate/to decentralize/to demote a party cadre to work on the shop floor or in the countryside
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: Lift brake lever for running out and lowering.
sentences.chinese: 抬起重锤使艇倒出并下放。

sentences.english: Lower drill string to top of pin and engage threads.
sentences.chinese: 下放钻柱至丝扣部分，拧上丝扣。

sentences.english: The central government has decided to devolve authority on the regions.
sentences.chinese: 中央政府已决定将权力下放给地方。

sentences.english: On the exhale bend your elbows and lower your chest onto your thighs.
sentences.chinese: 呼气时曲手肘，胸部向下放于大腿上。

sentences.english: But after a project is in motion, control necessarily decentralizes.
sentences.chinese: 但是当项目一经启动，就有必要下放控制力。

sentences.english: If we decentralize, the provinces will have more autonomy.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们将权力下放，各省就有更多的自主权。

sentences.english: I will sign the signature after any article in this blog.
sentences.chinese: 以后我都会在文章下放上这个签名档。

sentences.english: Lots of companies talk about decentralizing responsibility and authority.
sentences.chinese: 许多公司都谈论下放责任和权力。

sentences.english: As a first step, managers need to overcome the fear of losing control.
sentences.chinese: 但是作为第一步，管理人员需要克服权力下放的恐惧。

sentences.english: The full process of restoring devolution was only completed in 2010.
sentences.chinese: 归还下放权力的整个过程，方于2010年完成。

sentences.english: Store bananas at room temperature until they ripen.
sentences.chinese: 把香蕉于室温下放至成熟。

sentences.english: Put a bucket under the hole in the drain pipe to catch any overflow.
sentences.chinese: 在排水管的那个洞下放个水桶接住漏出的水。

sentences.english: IX. Without approval of the Ministry of Commerce, the local department shall not transfer the approval power to a lower level.
sentences.chinese: 未经商务部批准，地方部门不得下放此项审批权限。

sentences.english: When we set the table, we always set the plate upside-down.
sentences.chinese: 我们不管什么时候摆餐具，都得把碟子朝下放。

sentences.english: The filing level for foreign direct investment in real estate in the government has been lower down.
sentences.chinese: 商务部下放外商直接投资内地房地产备案权。

sentences.english: The refinement process can continue for any number of levels, until it finally reaches users.
sentences.chinese: 细化过程还可以逐级下放，直到最终达到用户为止。

definition: to change one's profession/to transfer to civilian work
to cancel/cancellation
to incline/to lean/to slant/to slope/to tilt
to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
to demobilize/demobilization
cadre/official/officer/manager
to reduce/to pare down/to streamline
higher authorities/superiors/CL:個|个[ge4]
to find a place for/to help settle down/to arrange for/to get into bed/placement
working hand/member of a work team/participant/(short form of 第一把手[di4 yi1 ba3 shou3]) the boss
central/middle/center/central authorities (of a state)
to temporarily transfer (personnel)
reform/CL:次[ci4],種|种[zhong3],項|项[xiang4]/to reform
to be transferred to another post/to post away
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
unofficial variant of 瞭[liao4]
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
(of eyes) bright/clear-sighted/to understand clearly
to rise through the ranks (as a party cadre)
